p: Edible mushrooms are famous for their highly nutrient constitution, as well as their tonic and medicinal values in medical applications. In recent decades, medicinal mushrooms has aroused much attention for their antitumor, immunomodulating, antiviral, hypocholesterolemia, and hepatoprotective activities ( 1). Many bioactive components isolated from edible mushrooms have been studied, including polysaccharides, terpenoids, lectins, proteins, and organic compounds ( 1, 2). They have been isolated not only from fruiting body but also the mycelium, and possess various chemical characteristics and biological effects on immune cells ( 2, 3).
